answers.answer: Hi!The treatment will depend on the type of infection—bacterial vaginosis, fungal infection, non-specific vaginitis due to low estrogen or low lactobacillus, or a STD. Hence, first you need to get a swab test done. Also, check and see whether you have developed diabetes in pregnancy (called gestational diabetes) as this increases your risk for infection. Usually you will be prescribed local treatments depending on what the swab culture shows. Also, good personal hygiene, and drinking plenty of water and fluids helps. Please discuss with your doctor.
